item.title: plrText
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“eagledude4, post:7, topic:299161”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=395516.msg2938418#msg2938418 date=1251707393]
f you didnt have an error, then what was the purpose of posting it here?
[/quote]

I think you missed the part where I said “I’m having trouble getting text to display”
Trouble usually requires help, and that’s why I posted it here.[/quote]

EDIT - the format you are using to display the text is incorrect. Try a diferent form, thats the conclusion i have came to, after attempting it on my server.

Read full topic

item.title: plrText
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“eagledude4, post:5, topic:299161”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=395516.msg2938424#msg2938424 date=1251707650]

Umm, in alot of servers its
text4 = “MESSAGE”;

That doesnt servers the purpose of a substring does it?

look over the post again and you might understand what I’m trying to do.

I know what it does, your trying to make what you put in the command appear above your head instead of both above your head and chatbox. Its not very complicated. The thing i dont get is what error you are having.
[/quote]

I dont have any error. but why would you tell me to use plrtext = “EXAMPLE” instead of the substring if you knew what the purpose was?[/quote]

If you didnt have an error, then what was the purpose of posting it here?

Read full topic

item.title: plrText
item.dc:creator: @eagledude4 eagledude4
item.description:
@eagledude4 wrote:

I’m having trouble getting this command to display text.

else if (command.startsWith("txt4") && command.length() > 5) { plrText = command.substring(5); plrTextUpdateRequired = true; }

I know my plrText method is correct because I use it for Vengeance.

Here’s another example of a non working plrtext:

else if (command.startsWith("test")) { say(); }

public void say(){ plrText = "testing"; plrTextUpdateRequired = true; }

Read full topic
